PHYS CS 5.title: Group Studies
PHYS CS 5.description: Student-directed discussion and study in a variety of subjects within Physics.

PHYS CS 10.title: Physics Colloquium
PHYS CS 10.comments: May be taken as often as once each quarter.
PHYS CS 10.description: Students receiving credit will present talks in their field on material  arranged in consultation with the instructor. Credit assigned by the   instructor will reflect the extent and quality of participation.

PHYS CS 15A.title: Introduction to Experimental Physics
PHYS CS 15A.prereq_description: Physics CS 31; consent of instructor; Creative Studies and CCS Physics majors only.
PHYS CS 15A.comments: Quarters usually offered: Fall. Not open for credit to students who have completed Physics 3HL or 13AH.
PHYS CS 15A.description: Covers the essence of experimental research. Students study three different systems experimentally, and write short Physical Review style articles about the results. Students are responsible for deciding what to measure, how to analyze data, and what conclusions can be reached.

PHYS CS 15B.title: Experimental Physics
PHYS CS 15B.prereq_description: Physics CS 15A; consent of instructor; Creative Studies and CCS Physics
PHYS CS 15B.comments: Concurrently offered with PHYS 13BH. Quarters usually offered: Winter. Not open for credit to students who have completed Physics 4HL or 13BH.
PHYS CS 15B.description: Computer control of experiments. Students learn LabView, and use it to measure and generate analog signals using a data acquisition card and a personal computer. Students ultimately use their computers to measure and control the temperature of a copper rod.

PHYS CS 15C.title: Experimental Physics
PHYS CS 15C.prereq_description: Physics CS 15B; consent of instructor; Creative Studies and CCS Physics
PHYS CS 15C.comments: Concurrently offered with PHYS 13CH. Quarters usually offered: Spring. Not open for credit to students who have completed Physics 5HL or 13CH.
PHYS CS 15C.description: Design and construction of apparatus, drafting and computer-  aided design.  Machine shop practice including use of all major machine tools. The class acts as a team to design and, time permitting, build a scientific apparatus for a campus research group.

PHYS CS 31.title: Newtonian Mechanics
PHYS CS 31.prereq_description: Consent of instructor; creative studies majors only.
PHYS CS 31.description: Vectors. Kinematics. Newton's laws of motion. Work and energy.     Conservativeforces. Momentum. Conservation of momentum. Center of mass   motion. Collisions. Systems with variable mass.

PHYS CS 32.title: Mechanics and Waves
PHYS CS 32.description: Oscillatory motion. Rotational Motion. Angular momentum gravity and centralforce motion. Elastic waves.

PHYS CS 33.title: Waves, Kinetic Theory and Relativity
PHYS CS 33.prereq_description: Physics CS 31 and 32; consent of instructor.
PHYS CS 33.description: Sound waves. Fluid dynamics. Kinetic theory of matter. The       Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution. Specific heat. Entropy. The special theory of relativity.

PHYS CS 34.title: Electromagnetism
PHYS CS 34.prereq_description: Consent of instructor; creative studies majors only.
PHYS CS 34.description: Electrostatics. DC circuits. Magnetostatics. Vector Potential.

PHYS CS 35.title: Electromagnetics and Optics
PHYS CS 35.prereq_description: Physics CS 34; consent of instructor; creative studies majors only.
PHYS CS 35.description: Faraday's Law of Induction. Magnetic materials. AC circuits. Maxwell's   equations. Electromagnetic waves. Ray optics. Wave optics. Diffraction   Theory.

PHYS CS 36.title: Quantum Physics
PHYS CS 36.prereq_description: Physics CS 34 and 35; consent of instructor; creative studies majors only.
PHYS CS 36.description: Wave-particle duality. Photons. Matter waves. The Uncertainty Principle. The Schrodinger Equation. Potential wells and barriers. The quantized  simple harmonic oscillator. The hydrogen atom.

PHYS CS 140AAZZ.title: Special Topics
PHYS CS 140AAZZ.description: Lectures on a coherent body of physical topics which are not usually presented in standard undergraduate physics courses.

PHYS CS 199.title: Independent Studies
PHYS CS 199.comments: Creative Studies students may enroll in a maximum of 24 units of     Independent Studies course per year, with a maximum of 45 units counted  toward graduation.
PHYS CS 199.description: Serious independent study in physics with consenting faculty member.
